alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 10 at 4:03PM EST until December 10 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN VANCE...WARREN...NORTHWESTERN HALIFAX...NORTHEASTERN WAKE AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 403 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles northeast of Louisburg, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Louisburg, Warrenton, Wake Forest, Franklinton, Norlina, Littleton, Bunn, Rolesville, Youngsville, and Macon. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for central North Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
